cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 mi SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the North/South Carolina coast, then forecast to slow and meander near the coastline before drifting inland over South Carolina–Georgia late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border (close to Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch) and North of NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light VA (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Hurricane Warning); North of Duck NC to NC/VA border (Tropical Storm Warning); extensive Storm-Surge Warnings for the same stretch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastlines of SC and NC with lesser effects extending south to coastal GA and northeast FL
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands may bring occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (25–35 kt) late Friday through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water level rise of 1–2 ft possible due to long-period swells; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent squally rain possible, highest on Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents through the weekend will affect vessel approaches and small-craft operations.
